meanings.definition: To disconnect or sever a relationship or connection.
meanings.sent1: I disrelate my old phone from the charger every morning.
meanings.sent2: It is important to disrelate the power source before repairing any electrical appliance.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to disrelate the chains, but they remained locked.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to disrelate herself from toxic friendships to find inner peace.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to disrelate from the spaceship to float freely in space.

meanings.definition: To fail to establish a connection or relationship.
meanings.sent1: The new student seemed to disrelate with his classmates at first.
meanings.sent2: Despite his efforts, he continued to disrelate with his distant relatives.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to disrelate with the cat, but they ended up becoming friends.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to disrelate with the difficult customer only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent5: The shy child tended to disrelate with strangers in social settings.

meanings.definition: To disregard or ignore a relationship or connection.
meanings.sent1: He would often disrelate his responsibilities towards his family.
meanings.sent2: She tends to disrelate the negative comments and focus on the positive ones.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to disrelate the false leads to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs would only disrelate you from your own safety.
meanings.sent5: It is not wise to disrelate the importance of regular exercise for good health.
